intro: Pleurolobus grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered pleurolobus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other plants with showy flowers. The plant features a woody stem with opposite, ovate leaves that have a smooth texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange with prominent orange or red tubular corollas, attracting pollinators like hummingbirds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
